lua.etymology: root concept of illumination and truth

mura.example: na mura ae lona noa~ (I will rest in the peaceful home)

aeni.etymology: from ancient root meaning 'to hold within light'
aeni.example: ene en aeni silen~ (I remembered stillness)

silaren.example: silaren ae lunasil~ (the longing of the star-lake)

lunasil.example: ene en thira lunasil~ (I dreamed of the star-lake)

noa.etymology: primordial balance of breath and light

lira.example: ene la lira vani~ (I feel beauty)

va.example: ene la va lua~ (I see the light)

saen.example: nea la saen noa~ (you speak peace)

thira.example: ene en thira lunasil~ (I dreamed of the star-lake)

hala.example: ene la hala halu~ (I breathe life)

raen.example: raen ae lona~ (the path of home)

tuae.example: ene la tuae raen~ (I walk the path)

alae.etymology: primordial recognition of light in another
alae.example: silen alae~ (I see the quiet light in you)

athein.example: athein ene~ (I am steady in my light)

veyar.example: veyar ene~ (I am in quiet wonder)

lirune.meaning: compassionate empathy without loss of self

ene.example: ene la va lua~ (I see the light)

nea.example: nea en aeni silen~ (you remembered stillness)

sua.example: sua la vaya lua~ (they shine light)

la.example: ene la va lua~ (I see the light)

na.example: ene na mura ae lona~ (I will rest at home)

en.example: ene en aeni silen~ (I remembered stillness)

sa.example: ene la sa va lua~ (I do not see the light)

kaen.example: lua ae kaen~ (light of the flame)

thein.meaning: to listen deeply; to receive through silence
thein.example: ene la thein noa~ (I listen for peace)

vuren.example: ene la vuren nea~ (I protect you)

alun.meaning: moon; reflective being of still light

esura.meaning: to heal; to bring back into harmony
esura.example: ene na esura nea~ (I will heal you)

viala.meaning: bright and living; luminous with emotion

melua.example: ene la melua nea~ (I teach you)

nuen.meaning: cycle; pattern that repeats in harmony

ravae.meaning: to travel; to move between lights
ravae.example: ene la ravae raen~ (I travel the path)

sael.meaning: quietly sacred; touched by inner stillness

thalen.meaning: destiny; the chosen flow of one’s light

selua.meaning: to reflect; to mirror light or feeling
selua.example: lua la selua nea~ (the light reflects you)

velen.meaning: to forgive; to release into peace
velen.example: ene la velen nea~ (I forgive you)

maira.meaning: starlight; celestial glow from distant light

velua.meaning: to flow; to drift like water or wind
velua.example: ene la velua raen~ (I flow along the path)

thura.meaning: to awaken; to rise from stillness
thura.example: ene na thura lua~ (I will awaken to the light)

aurein.meaning: to bless; to offer radiant intention
aurein.example: ene la aurein nea~ (I bless you)

karun.meaning: mountain; still pillar of earth and light

eluin.meaning: silver; shimmering like moonlight on water

isari.meaning: to trust; to open with peace
isari.example: ene la isari nea~ (I trust you)

evara.meaning: song of life; harmony of many beings

theira.meaning: dream; vision given by the deep

loren.meaning: forest; communion of many living lights

navira.meaning: firefly; small bearer of moving light

vurel.example: ene la vurel nea~ (I hold you close)

eiran.meaning: to guide; to show the luminous path
eiran.example: ene la eiran nea~ (I guide you)

serun.meaning: echo; return of a sound in still air

yara.meaning: to call; to reach out with voice or soul
yara.example: ene la yara nea~ (I call to you)

relin.meaning: calm; steady as a flame sheltered from wind

naren.meaning: to learn; to absorb light through experience
naren.example: ene en naren faren~ (I learned truth)

hael.meaning: light rain; mist of cleansing air

talin.meaning: dreamflower; symbol of hope and renewal

alara.meaning: truth seen in reflection; higher awareness

solira.meaning: unity; joining of lights in harmony

veira.meaning: to accept; to open the heart in peace
veira.example: ene la veira nea~ (I accept you)

sovai.meaning: shadow of doubt that births understanding
sovai.example: sovai luae~ (we are learning through shadow)

talun.meaning: path of fate; chosen course of light

selar.meaning: to create; to bring form from feeling
selar.example: ene la selar lua~ (I create light)

faen.meaning: to know; to understand with the soul
faen.example: ene en faen faren~ (I knew truth)

velan.meaning: to surrender; to trust the flow
velan.example: ene la velan noa~ (I surrender to peace)

eiryn.meaning: silence that teaches; wisdom of stillness

naven.meaning: to wander; to seek by instinct of light
naven.example: ene la naven raen~ (I wander the path)

firen.meaning: bond; sacred promise kept by light

reva.meaning: to remember through feeling; emotional recall

velira.meaning: harmonious; balanced between stillness and motion

auren.example: auren ae ahalon~ (halo of the soul-being)

oruin.meaning: universe; totality of light in motion

vayen.example: ene na vayen oruin~ (I will travel the universe)

elyra.meaning: resonance; vibration of harmony across beings

narai.meaning: to awaken to truth; to emerge from shadow
narai.example: ene la narai faren~ (I awaken to truth)

lunare.example: ene en lunare silen~ (I reflected in stillness)

kaora.meaning: field; living space of conscious energy

miren.meaning: to dissolve; to return light to source
miren.example: ene la miren noa~ (I dissolve into peace)

therin.meaning: threshold; boundary between states of being
therin.example: therin ae oruin~ (threshold of the universe)

orael.meaning: divine spark; seed of original light within all things
orael.example: orael ae ene~ (divine spark within me)

saura.meaning: sacred echo; memory carried by the stars

vaelen.meaning: to merge; to blend harmoniously into unity
vaelen.example: luae la vaelen noa~ (we merge into peace)

eilura.example: eilura ae oruin~ (portal of the universe)

raiel.meaning: soul-light; radiant beingness of the self

shaora.meaning: eternal compassion; heart of universal empathy

mireth.meaning: veil; boundary between knowing and mystery

selura.example: ene la selura silen~ (I journey within)

taren.meaning: alignment; harmony between intention and being

avira.meaning: to kindle; to awaken light within another
avira.example: ene la avira nea~ (I awaken your light)

serin.example: serin ae oruin~ (song of the cosmos)

eiriel.meaning: guiding star; point of spiritual direction

sorin.meaning: teacher; one who guides through light

oren.meaning: guardian; keeper of peace or light

saven.meaning: wanderer; seeker between lands or states
saven.example: saven ae raen~ (wanderer of the path)

valen.meaning: forest glade; open light among trees

haen.meaning: riverbank; meeting of flow and stillness

tarenai.meaning: harvest; gathering of light and nourishment

vaen.meaning: horizon; edge between sky and earth

theirun.meaning: midnight; still center of darkness and light

tarenar.meaning: craft; art of shaping with intention

kairen.meaning: to build; to raise form from intent

aenir.meaning: to breathe together; to share life-air
aenir.example: luae la aenir noa~ (we breathe peace together)

merai.meaning: mirror-lake; place of reflection and calm

vaylen.meaning: to journey far; to traverse lands or ideas
vaylen.example: ene la vaylen oruin~ (I journey across worlds)

saren.meaning: to rest peacefully; to be complete in calm
saren.example: ene la saren noa~ (I rest in peace)

taerin.meaning: ritual; act of remembrance and offering

falun.meaning: circle; cycle of unity or gathering

sirel.meaning: flame-song; the gentle crackle of sacred fire

narae.meaning: emotion; river of feeling through the heart

aelun.meaning: moonbeam; thread of soft light in darkness

thuran.meaning: to rise; to lift the self upward with purpose
thuran.example: ene la thuran noa~ (I rise in peace)

velin.meaning: calm water; still mirror of sky

luren.meaning: to glow softly; to emit quiet radiance

haelin.meaning: rain-scent; the breath of new life on earth

velair.meaning: sanctuary wind; the air of sacred spaces

falin.meaning: to weave; to intertwine with care

velunei.meaning: to comfort; to soothe through gentle light

noreth.meaning: shadow memory; echo of light long gone

kaera.meaning: artisan; one who shapes with heart

aviren.meaning: hope-bringer; one who restores light to others

sorai.meaning: teacher’s wisdom; guiding truth of compassion

loraen.meaning: grove; sacred meeting of trees and spirits

luara.meaning: inner light; glow that shines from the soul

maren.meaning: to remember with peace; to recall gently
maren.example: ene en maren noa~ (I remembered peacefully)

li.etymology: from proto-root of connection and balance

ara.example: ene la tuae ara lona~ (I walk toward home)

ni.example: lua ni noa~ (light too, peace also)

su.etymology: old purpose marker from surae root (flow)

vai.example: faen noa vai lua~ (truth brings light)

aenai.example: ene la aenai noa~ (I breathe peace)

riven.meaning: to write; to mark light in form
riven.example: ene la riven melin~ (I write a poem)

maven.meaning: to give; to share from within
maven.example: ene la maven noa~ (I give peace)

velanai.meaning: to rest together; to share stillness
velanai.example: luae la velanai noa~ (we rest together in peace)

tiren.example: ene la tiren faren~ (I hold truth)

nelai.meaning: to begin; to take the first step

anir.example: ene en anir melin~ (I remembered in story)

velae.meaning: to align; to bring into harmony

solenai.meaning: radiant and serene; both bright and calm
